Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Statistics accumulates the results of the experiments. It know ahead of time how many experiments will be run, and provides at the end the min, the max, the average and the standard deviation for the data. this class should not use classes such as Array, Lists etc. to store the data, only prinitive types and java arrays.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Statistics

        public Statistics(int numberOfRuns)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        numberOfRuns - the number of experiments that will be run

    • Method Detail

      • updateStatistics

        public void updateStatistics(int value)
        Updates statistics after one experiment. This method cannot be called more times than the paramter that was passed in the constructor. If it is, an error message should be printed and no change should occur.
        Parameters:
        value - the result of the new experiment

      • average

        public double average()
        Returns:
        the current average of the values passed to the method updateStatistic

      • standardDeviation

        public double standardDeviation()
        Returns:
        the current standard deviation of the values passed to the method updateStatistic

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns the complete statistics information: current minimum, current maximim, current average and current standard deviation. For the last two, only two digits decimals are shown
